statement.tex:
\text{FInd all points of discontinuity of f,\\ where f is defined by }\\
f(x) = \begin{cases} \vert x \vert + 3,&if\, x \leq -3\\ -2x,\,&if -3\lt x\lt 2 \\ 6x +2,&if \, x\gt 3\\ \end{cases}

step.context: \text{Which of these is the correct definition \\ of the function?}

step.tex: f(x) \text{ is a straight line for }x\neq 3,-3.\\ \text{Hence, it is continuous for all }x\neq 3,-3.\\ \text{But we need to check for continuity \\ at x=3 and x=-3.}\\
step.reason: \text{Since, at x=3,-3 the definition of the \\ function changes, hence x=3,-3 can \\only be the problem points, so we need to \\check continuity there.}

step.tex: \lim_{x\to -3^-}f(x) = \lim_{x\to -3^-}(x+3)=6\\ \lim_{x\to -3^-}f(x) = \lim_{x\to -3^-}(x+3)=6\\ f(-3) = -(-3)+3 = 6\\ \\ \lim_{x\to 3^-}f(x) = \lim_{x\to 3^-} (-2x) = -6\\ \lim_{x\to 3^+}f(x) = \lim_{x\to-3^+} (6x+2) = 20 \\ f(3)=6(3)+2=20\\ \\ \text{Hence, f(x) is discontinuous at x=3.}\\ \therefore \text{x=3,3 is the only point of\\ discontinuity.}

choices.tex: \text{x=3 is the only point of discontinuity}
\text{x=-3 is the only point of discontinuity}
